intro: Navarretia gossypifera, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white or pink flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Navarretia gossypifera is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in spring, producing a cluster of flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
